text.*:
Loki in the Underworld

Chapter Info

Volume:

111

Chapter:

1131

Japanese Title:

冥界のロキ

Romanized Title:

Meikai no Roki

Viz Title:

Loki in the Underworld

Pages:

17

Release Date:

November 11, 2024

WSJ Issue:

2024 Issue 50
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1131 is titled "Loki in the Underworld".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage, Vol. 18: "After that sword thief!!"

Short Summary[]

Luffy learns he is in the Underworld of Elbaph, where Loki has been imprisoned for over six years. Loki reveals that he had an encounter with Shanks, but refuses to reveal the details unless Luffy frees him. Meanwhile, the other Straw Hats on Elbaph are chased by Road with Gerd and Goldberg following. Hajrudin and Stansen are preparing a feast for the crew, while the Great Eirik nears Elbaph and Robin prepares for her reunion with Saul. Elsewhere, Saul has collapsed.

Long Summary[]

Luffy is ecstatic to learn he has reached Elbaph after longing to see it for some time. He starts talking about how he had never seen so many giants together in one place on the Greak Eirik and he hopes Usopp figures out they have made it too once he climbs up the giant tree. As he was talking, an irate Loki finally gets Luffy's attention after trying to speak to him, while also informing Luffy that as he is in the presence of the "Sun God", he is to not speak without his permission, as Loki's title is shown, revealing that the World Government put a special bounty of 2,600,000,000 Belly on him.

Loki asks Luffy what he makes of his current predicament, and Luffy obviously states he is chained up. Loki states he wishes to be freed as he has been chained up for six years, and while he considers himself the strongest Giant in Elbaph, the tree he is chained to is Treasure Tree Adam, the sturdiest tree in existence, and in addition, the chains are made of Seastone, which inhibit his Devil Fruit powers. Knowing Luffy is a pirate, Loki asks him that if he frees him, he will destroy a rival pirate crew of his choice. Of course, Loki says he will not force Luffy to do anything, but with that said, he reveals their particular location is called the "Underworld" of Elbaph, where those judged as criminals are sentenced to and is surrounded by ginormous beasts who will destroy anyone, though Loki states the beasts are all his friends, and therefore, if Luffy does not do as Loki says, the beasts will kill him. However, when Luffy sees the beasts, he reminisces of his time on Rusukaina instead.

Several humans appear as well, who Loki says tried to fight Elbaph only to be defeated and sentenced here, with them all wearing stinking robes to ward off the beasts, though they seem to be loyal to Loki. The men hope that they will not be knocked unconscious like last time because of Shanks, but hearing his name gets Luffy's attention, just as he tames the beasts himself to the astonishment of the men and Loki. Luffy asks if Shanks really did come to Elbaph, and sensing his admiration of him, Loki calls him a "cowardly" pirate. Angered by this, Luffy immediately changes to Gear Fourth and tries to punch Loki, who swiftly moves his head to avoid the attack. Loki tells Luffy he was only joking, but Luffy angrily tells Loki to never joke like that again. As for Loki, he thinks to himself that the minute he is free, he will kill Luffy for attacking him while defenseless. Once he calms down, Luffy asks Loki why Shanks was in Elbaph and if he is still here, but Loki says he will not give him that information for free.

Meanwhile, with Zoro's group, the five of them are still climbing the rope bridge up the tree, but Usopp sees from afar that Road is running behind him, deducing he was the Sun God because he looks like he was zapped by lightning. Also, Gerd and Goldberg are chasing after him, with the latter carrying the Thousand Sunny in his hands. Zoro considers fighting back, but Usopp stops him, saying they could be friends with Dorry and Brogy, so they should instead run to the nearest village for safety and answers. Elsewhere, Hajrudin and Stansen have taken down a giant moose for its meat, intending the serve it to the Straw Hats.

On the Great Eirik, Brook has just finished giving Robin a haircut, though he was quite nervous due to it being his first time. However, he is told he did a great job as Robin's hair now looks how it did two years ago. Dorry and Brogy learn it is because it was how she looked when she first met Saul, while Franky, Oimo, and Kashii feel nostalgic because it reminds him of when they first met. The crew then finally arrive at Elbaph, but elsewhere, a giant yells that Saul has fallen and cannot get up.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Loki attempts to bargain with Luffy for his freedom.
    • Loki has been given a "special" bounty of 2,600,000,000 by the World Government.
    • It is revealed that Loki was imprisoned six years ago.
  • The giant tree of Elbaph is confirmed to be Treasure Tree Adam.
  • Road has recovered from Nami's attack and is currently fleeing from Gerd and Goldberg.
    • Goldberg retrieves the Thousand Sunny from Road's castle.
  • Robin asks Brook to restyle her hair back to what she had it two years ago.
  • It is reported that Saul has collapsed.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


I went to South Africa! I return home with gratefulness and the motivation to keep working! I'll do better at everything!


南アフリカ行ってきました!!感謝と共に身を引き締めて帰国っ!!全て頑張る!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.
